intro: Didissandra clemensiae, commonly known as the Cleft-leaf Drupe, is a rare and unique plant species native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Sarcandraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, deeply lobed leaves that resemble a split or cleft. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by fleshy, berry-like fruits that are edible. Its botanical significance lies in its morphological uniqueness and its role in the biodiversity of its native habitat. Due to its rarity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
